title: Will my grades be reduced if I apply for revaluation?
content: Is there is a possibility of my grades reducing if I apply for revaluation? How often do grades actually increase from revaluation?

comments.body: High chances but be ready to take the risk of you're confident of getting extra marks!
While it's theoretically possible for grades to decrease, I haven't really heard of such cases. But yes, it *can* happen and it's a risk you will need to take during reval.
Recently applied for reval, enquired with my professors regarding grade reduction before applying, they said it wouldnâ€™t reduce, but may or may not increase
There won't be any reduction in grades. It will only increase, but increase happens only if you know for sure you've done well
